title: Designing Inclusive UDL-Based Asynchronous Online Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of Basic Linguistics and Experience with Digital Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Customized language education design for learners with diverse professional backgrounds

learning_goals: Learners achieve a 30% improvement in language proficiency by utilizing diverse learning materials (text, audio, video) based on UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles.
Learners autonomously develop learning plans in asynchronous environments and achieve an 80% or higher assignment submission rate.
Learners earn a collaboration score of 4.0/5.0 or higher in project-based assessments through a peer feedback system.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
